skill.name: docs-retrieval
skill.description: Retrieve documentation context from local ai-docs. Check here first when implementing features, debugging errors, or needing library information. Fall back to web search if topic not found locally.
skill.summary: Efficient documentation retrieval from hierarchical local documentation system
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and instructional markdown files with no executable code. All static findings are false positives from pattern matching backticks in code examples and MD5 in the GitHub URL. No security risks identified.

content.user_title: Retrieve Documentation from Local Knowledge Base
content.value_statement: Finding the right documentation while coding wastes time and breaks focus. This skill enables Claude to efficiently retrieve context from local documentation using hierarchical navigation patterns optimized for token efficiency.
actual_capabilities: Navigate hierarchical documentation using index files and page summaries
Retrieve targeted documentation context within specified token budgets
Search across multiple libraries using keyword matching patterns
Consolidate documentation from multiple sources into unified context
Load full documentation context when comprehensive understanding is needed
Provide pre-loaded documentation context to sub-agents
limitations: Only retrieves from local ai-docs directory structure, not external sources
Requires documentation to be formatted in TOON hierarchical structure
Token budget limits the amount of context that can be loaded at once
Does not generate or modify documentation content

use_cases.title: Library Integration Development
use_cases.description: Developer needs to integrate a new library into their project. Skill retrieves API documentation, error handling patterns, and gotchas to accelerate implementation.
use_cases.target_user: Software developers implementing features with external libraries

use_cases.title: Error Debugging with Library Context
use_cases.description: Developer encounters an error from an external dependency. Skill retrieves troubleshooting documentation and known issues to resolve the problem faster.
use_cases.target_user: Engineers debugging issues with third-party libraries

use_cases.title: Multi-Agent Task Coordination
use_cases.description: Parent agent needs to spawn sub-agents with pre-loaded documentation context. Skill gathers and consolidates relevant documentation to pass to sub-agents, avoiding redundant navigation.
use_cases.target_user: AI agents coordinating complex multi-step tasks

prompt_templates.title: Find Library Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Check ai-docs for BAML library documentation on error handling and retry policies
prompt_templates.scenario: You need to implement retry logic for an LLM call using the BAML library

prompt_templates.title: Search Documentation by Topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Search local docs for information about structured output parsing - not sure which library covers this
prompt_templates.scenario: You need to parse structured data but are unsure which library to use

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Library Context Gathering
prompt_templates.prompt: Load documentation context for integrating MCP with Claude Code - need both libraries
prompt_templates.scenario: Building an integration that spans multiple libraries

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Library Understanding
prompt_templates.prompt: Load full TOON library documentation for comprehensive understanding of the format and best practices
prompt_templates.scenario: Learning a new documentation format or preparing for major architectural decisions

output_examples.input: Check ai-docs for BAML retry configuration
output_examples.output:
Documentation Context:

BAML: Error Handling
Purpose: Configure retry policies and timeout behavior for LLM calls
Key Points:
- RetryPolicy supports exponential backoff
- Timeouts can be set per-call or globally
Gotchas:
- Default timeout is 30s which may be too short for complex prompts
- Retry count includes initial attempt

Sources: ai-docs/libraries/baml/guide/pages/error-handling.toon
Tokens: ~400

output_examples.input: Find documentation on structured output parsing
output_examples.output:
Keyword search results:
- BAML: Structured LLM outputs with type safety [MATCH]
- MCP: Tool integration protocol [NO MATCH]

Loading BAML documentation on type system and parsing...

BAML: Type System
Purpose: Define structured schemas for LLM outputs
Key Points:
- Support for classes, enums, and unions
- Automatic validation and parsing
- Type-safe code generation

best_practices: Always check local documentation before web search to save time and tokens
Use targeted page retrieval instead of full-context loading for specific questions
Pre-load documentation context for sub-agents to avoid redundant navigation
anti_patterns: Loading full-context documentation when only one specific topic is needed
Spawning sub-agents without passing pre-loaded documentation context
Loading all libraries mentioned in a task instead of only required ones

faq.question: When should I use this skill instead of web search?
faq.answer: Use this skill first for any library or tool that might have local documentation. Local docs are faster, more token-efficient, and include pre-extracted gotchas. Fall back to web search only when the topic is not found locally or you need current information.

faq.question: What is the TOON format mentioned in the skill?
faq.answer: TOON is a hierarchical documentation format optimized for LLM consumption. It uses index files for navigation and page summaries that provide high-signal context in fewer tokens compared to full documentation pages.

faq.question: How much does documentation retrieval cost in tokens?
faq.answer: Token costs vary by retrieval type. Index files cost 100-250 tokens, page summaries cost 250-450 tokens, and full-context loading costs 5000-15000 tokens. The skill recommends targeted retrieval to stay within budget.

faq.question: Can this skill search across multiple libraries at once?
faq.answer: Yes, the multi-library gathering pattern allows you to identify all required libraries, load their relevant documentation pages, and consolidate the context into a single unified block.

faq.question: What happens if the documentation I need does not exist locally?
faq.answer: The skill instructs Claude to fall back to web search when local documentation does not cover the topic. Always check local first, then use web search as a secondary option.

faq.question: How does this skill help with spawning sub-agents?
faq.answer: The skill teaches Claude to pre-load documentation context before spawning sub-agents and include it in the spawn prompt. This prevents each sub-agent from navigating documentation from scratch, saving tokens and time.
